questions.question: What are the three main formats for storing digital evidence in forensic acquisition tools?
options: Raw format, proprietary formats, and Advanced Forensics Format (AFF)
questions.answer: Raw format, proprietary formats, and Advanced Forensics Format (AFF)

questions.question: What is a major disadvantage of the raw format for data acquisition?
options: It cannot be read by most forensic tools
It requires as much storage space as the original data
It only works on Windows systems
questions.answer: It requires as much storage space as the original data

questions.question: What is a key disadvantage of proprietary formats in forensic tools?
options: They are always slower than raw format
Inability to share images between different tools
questions.answer: Inability to share images between different tools

questions.question: What does AFF stand for in digital forensics?
questions.answer: Advanced Forensics Format

questions.question: What is the most common method of data acquisition?
questions.answer: Creating a disk-to-image file

questions.question: When is a disk-to-disk acquisition method typically used?
options: When you need the fastest possible copy
When disk-to-image copy is not possible
When only specific files are needed
questions.answer: When disk-to-image copy is not possible

questions.question: What is logical acquisition used for?
options: Capturing only specific files of interest to the case
questions.answer: Capturing only specific files of interest to the case

questions.question: What is sparse acquisition?
options: Making compressed copies of active files
questions.answer: Collecting fragments of unallocated (deleted) data

questions.question: How many images of digital evidence should be made during acquisition?
questions.answer: At least two

questions.question: What feature in Windows makes static acquisitions more difficult?
questions.answer: BitLocker whole disk encryption

questions.question: What does Mini-WinFE enable you to do?
options: Build a Linux forensic boot CD
Build a Windows forensic boot CD/DVD or USB drive
questions.answer: Build a Windows forensic boot CD/DVD or USB drive

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using Linux Live CDs for forensics?
options: They are more expensive than Windows tools
They automatically mount all drives for easy access
They don't automatically mount storage media, eliminating need for write-blockers
They only work on Linux systems
questions.answer: They don't automatically mount storage media, eliminating need for write-blockers

questions.question: What does RAID stand for?
questions.answer: Redundant Array of Independent Disks

questions.question: Which RAID level provides striping without redundancy?
questions.answer: RAID 0

questions.question: Which RAID level provides mirroring for data redundancy?
questions.answer: RAID 1

questions.question: Which is the most popular RAID level for balanced performance and redundancy?
questions.answer: RAID 5

questions.question: Which RAID level can tolerate two disk failures?
questions.answer: RAID 6

questions.question: What does PDServer do in ProDiscover?
options: Serves as a remote agent for remote access
questions.answer: Serves as a remote agent for remote access

questions.question: What is a major drawback of remote network acquisition tools?
options: They are always slower than physical acquisitions
Antivirus and firewall tools can be configured to ignore them
They only work on Windows systems
questions.answer: Antivirus and firewall tools can be configured to ignore them

questions.question: What is F-Response designed to do?
options: Set up security read-only connections for any forensic program
questions.answer: Set up security read-only connections for any forensic program

questions.question: What is the purpose of validation in data acquisition?
options: To speed up the acquisition process
To verify the integrity of acquired data using hashing algorithms
questions.answer: To verify the integrity of acquired data using hashing algorithms

questions.question: What types of hashing algorithms are used for validation?
options: CRC-32, MD5, and SHA-1 to SHA-512
questions.answer: CRC-32, MD5, and SHA-1 to SHA-512

questions.question: What should always be used with GUI acquisition tools on Windows systems?
questions.answer: Write-blocking devices or utilities

questions.question: What is the first rule when dealing with RAID acquisitions?
options: Always use the fastest acquisition method
Determine the type of RAID and appropriate acquisition tool
questions.answer: Determine the type of RAID and appropriate acquisition tool

questions.question: What does IXimager work exclusively with?
questions.answer: ILook Investigator
